sentence_0001.sentence: A frail-looking young man with pale skin and dark circles under his eyes was sitting on a rusty bench across from the police station.
sentence_0001.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0002.sentence: He was cradling a cup of coffee in his hands — not the cheap synthetic type slum rats like him had access to, but the real deal.
sentence_0002.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0003.sentence: This cup of plant-based coffee, usually available only to higher rank citizens, had cost most of his savings.
sentence_0003.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0004.sentence: But on this particular day, Sunny decided to pamper himself.
sentence_0004.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0005.sentence: After all, his life was coming to an end.
sentence_0005.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0006.sentence: Enjoying the warmth of the luxurious drink, he raised the cup and savored the aroma.
sentence_0006.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0007.sentence: Then, tentatively, he took a small sip… and immediately grimaced.
sentence_0007.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0009.sentence: Giving the cup of coffee an intense look, Sunny sighed and forced himself to drink some more.
sentence_0009.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0010.sentence: I should have bought a piece of real meat instead. Who knew actual coffee is so disgusting? Well. It's going to keep me awake, at least.
sentence_0010.speaker: Sunny

sentence_0011.sentence: He stared into the distance, dozing off, and then slapped himself in the face to wake up.
sentence_0011.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0013.sentence: Shaking his head and cursing, Sunny finished the coffee and stood up.
sentence_0013.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0014.sentence: Rich people living in this part of the city were rushing past the small park on their way to work, staring at him with strange expressions.
sentence_0014.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0015.sentence: Looking haggard in his cheap clothes and from the lack of sleep, unhealthily thin and pale, Sunny was indeed out of his place here.
sentence_0015.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0017.sentence: Watching them with a bit of envy, he tossed the cup into a garbage bin.
sentence_0017.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0018.sentence: I guess that's what three full meals a day would do to you.
sentence_0018.speaker: Sunny

sentence_0019.sentence: The cup missed the bin by a wide margin and fell on the ground.
sentence_0019.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0020.sentence: Sunny rolled his eyes in exasperation, walked over and picked it up before carefully putting it in the trash.
sentence_0020.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0021.sentence: Then, with a slight grin, he crossed the street and entered the police station.
sentence_0021.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0022.sentence: Inside, a tired-looking officer gave him a quick glance and frowned with obvious distaste.
sentence_0022.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0024.sentence: Sunny looked around with curiosity, noting reinforced armor plates on the walls and poorly hidden turret nests in the ceiling.
sentence_0024.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0025.sentence: The officer, too, looked scruffy and mean.
sentence_0025.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0026.sentence: At least police stations remained the same wherever you go.
sentence_0026.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0029.sentence: Then he scratched the back of his head and added:
sentence_0029.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0030.sentence: As demanded by the Third Special Directive, I am here to surrender myself as a carrier of the Nightmare Spell.
sentence_0030.speaker: Sunny

sentence_0031.sentence: Are you sure you are infected? When did you start showing symptoms?
sentence_0031.speaker: Officer

sentence_0035.sentence: Then, with a hurried motion, he pressed a button on his terminal and bellowed:
sentence_0035.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0036.sentence: Attention! Code Black in the lobby! I repeat! CODE BLACK!
sentence_0036.speaker: Officer

sentence_0037.sentence: The Nightmare Spell first appeared in the world a few decades ago.
sentence_0037.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0038.sentence: Back then, the planet was just starting to recover from a series of devastating natural disasters and subsequent resource wars.
sentence_0038.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0039.sentence: At first, the emergence of a new disease that caused millions of people to complain about constant fatigue and sleepiness did not attract a lot of attention.
sentence_0039.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0040.sentence: But when they started to fall into an unnatural slumber, with no sign of waking up even days later, governments finally panicked.
sentence_0040.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0041.sentence: Of course, by then it was already too late — not that an early response could have made any difference.
sentence_0041.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0042.sentence: When the infected started dying in their sleep, their dead bodies turning into monsters, no one was ready.
sentence_0042.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0043.sentence: Nightmare Creatures quickly overwhelmed national militaries, plunging the world into complete chaos.
sentence_0043.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0044.sentence: No one knew what the Spell was, what powers it possessed, and how to fight it.
sentence_0044.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0045.sentence: In the end, it was the Awakened — those who survived the first trials of the Spell and came back alive — who put a stop to its rampage.
sentence_0045.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0046.sentence: Armed with miraculous abilities earned in their Nightmares, they restored peace and created a semblance of a new order.
sentence_0046.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0047.sentence: Of course, it was only the first of the catastrophes brought upon by the Spell.
sentence_0047.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0048.sentence: But as far as Sunny was concerned, none of it had anything to do with him — not until a few days ago, that is, when he first started having trouble with staying awake.
sentence_0048.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0049.sentence: For an average person, being chosen by the Spell was as much of a risk as an opportunity.
sentence_0049.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0050.sentence: Kids learned survival skills and fighting techniques in school, on the off chance of being infected.
sentence_0050.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0051.sentence: Well-to-do families hired private tutors to train their children in all sorts of martial arts.
sentence_0051.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0052.sentence: Those from the Awakened clans even had access to powerful legacies, wielding inherited Memories and Echoes in their first visit to the Dream Realm.
sentence_0052.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0053.sentence: The richer your family was, the better your chances of surviving and becoming an Awakened were.
sentence_0053.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0054.sentence: But for Sunny, who had no family to speak of and spent most of his time scrounging for food instead of going to school, being chosen by the Spell presented no opportunity at all.
sentence_0054.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0055.sentence: To him, it was basically a death sentence.
sentence_0055.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0056.sentence: A few minutes later, Sunny was yawning while several policemen were busy putting him in restraints.
sentence_0056.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0057.sentence: Soon he was fastened into a bulky chair that looked like a weird mix between a hospital bed and a torture device.
sentence_0057.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0058.sentence: The room they were in was situated in the basement of the police station, with thick armored walls and a formidable-looking vault door.
sentence_0058.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0059.sentence: Other officers were standing near the walls, with automatic rifles in their hands and grim expressions on their faces.
sentence_0059.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0060.sentence: Sunny did not particularly care about them.
sentence_0060.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0061.sentence: The only thing he could think about was how much he wanted to sleep.
sentence_0061.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0062.sentence: Finally, the vault door opened, and a gray-haired policeman walked in.
sentence_0062.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0063.sentence: He had a seasoned face and stern eyes, looking like someone who had seen a lot of terrible things in his life.
sentence_0063.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0064.sentence: After checking the restraints, the policeman glanced quickly on his wristwatch and then turned to Sunny:
sentence_0064.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0067.sentence: The old policeman raised an eyebrow.
sentence_0067.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0069.sentence: What's so strange about it? At least I have a name. Back in the outskirts, not everyone even gets one.
sentence_0069.speaker: Sunny

sentence_0070.sentence: It's because I was born during a solar eclipse. My mom had a poetic soul, you see.
sentence_0070.speaker: Sunny

sentence_0071.sentence: That's why he got this weird-ass name and his little sister was called Rain… back when she still lived with them, at least.
sentence_0071.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0072.sentence: Whether it was the result of poetic imagination or simple laziness, he did not know.
sentence_0072.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0074.sentence: Do you want me to contact your family?
sentence_0074.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0076.sentence: For a second, there was a dark look on the policeman's face.
sentence_0076.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0078.sentence: Alright, Sunless. How long can you stay awake?
sentence_0078.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0081.sentence: Then we don't have time for the full procedure. Try to resist for as long as you can and listen to me very carefully. Okay?
sentence_0081.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0082.sentence: Not waiting for a response, he added:
sentence_0082.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0083.sentence: How much do you know about the Nightmare Spell?
sentence_0083.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0084.sentence: As much as anyone, I guess? Who doesn't know about the Spell?
sentence_0084.speaker: Sunny

sentence_0085.sentence: Not the fancy stuff you see in dramas and hear in the propaganda broadcasts. I mean how much do you really know?
sentence_0085.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0086.sentence: That was a hard question to answer.
sentence_0086.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0087.sentence: Don't I just go into the Dream Realm, kill a few monsters to complete the First Nightmare, receive magic powers and become an Awakened?
sentence_0087.speaker: Sunny

sentence_0088.sentence: Listen carefully. Once you fall asleep, you will be transported inside your First Nightmare.
sentence_0088.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0089.sentence: Nightmares are trials created by the Spell.
sentence_0089.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0090.sentence: Once inside, you will meet monsters, sure, but you will also meet people.
sentence_0090.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0091.sentence: Remember: they are not real. They're just illusions conjured up to test you.
sentence_0091.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0093.sentence: I mean, no one understands what the Spell is and how it works, right? So how do you know that they're not real?
sentence_0093.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0094.sentence: You might have to kill them, kid. So do yourself a favor and just think about them as illusions.
sentence_0094.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0096.sentence: A lot of things about the First Nightmare depend on luck.
sentence_0096.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0097.sentence: Generally, it shouldn't be overwhelmingly hard.
sentence_0097.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0098.sentence: The situation you're in, the tools you have at your disposal and the creatures you have to defeat should be within the range of your abilities, at least.
sentence_0098.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0099.sentence: After all, the Spell sets up trials, not executions.
sentence_0099.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0100.sentence: You're a bit disadvantaged due to… well… your circumstances.
sentence_0100.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0101.sentence: But kids from the outskirts are tough. Don't give up on yourself just yet.
sentence_0101.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0103.sentence: Sunny was getting more and more sleepy.
sentence_0103.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0104.sentence: It was becoming hard to follow the conversation.
sentence_0104.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0105.sentence: About those "magic powers" you mentioned… you will indeed receive them if you survive until the end of the Nightmare.
sentence_0105.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0106.sentence: What those powers will be, exactly, depends on your natural affinity as well what you do during the trial.
sentence_0106.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0107.sentence: But some of it will be at your disposal right from the start…
sentence_0107.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0108.sentence: The voice of the old policeman sounded more and more distant.
sentence_0108.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0109.sentence: Sunny's eyelids were so heavy that he was struggling to keep his eyes open.
sentence_0109.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0110.sentence: Remember: the first thing you must do once inside the Nightmare is to check your Attributes and your Aspect.
sentence_0110.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0111.sentence: If you get a combat-oriented Aspect, something like a Swordsman or an Archer, things will be easier.
sentence_0111.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0112.sentence: If it is reinforced by a physical Attribute, then that's even better.
sentence_0112.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0113.sentence: Combat Aspects are the most common, so the probability of receiving one is high.
sentence_0113.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0114.sentence: The armored room was growing dimmer.
sentence_0114.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0115.sentence: If you're unlucky and your Aspect has nothing to do with combat, don't despair.
sentence_0115.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0116.sentence: Sorcery and utility Aspects are useful in their own ways, you'll just have to be smart about it.
sentence_0116.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0117.sentence: There are really no useless Aspects. Well, almost.
sentence_0117.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0118.sentence: So just do anything in your power to survive.
sentence_0118.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0119.sentence: If you survive, you will be halfway to becoming an Awakened.
sentence_0119.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0120.sentence: But if you die, you'll open a gate for a Nightmare Creature to appear in the real world.
sentence_0120.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0121.sentence: Which means that my colleagues and I will have to deal with it.
sentence_0121.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0123.sentence: Already half-asleep, Sunny felt a bit touched by the policeman's words.
sentence_0123.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0124.sentence: Or, at least, try to not die right away.
sentence_0124.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0125.sentence: The nearest Awakened won't be able to get here for a few hours, so we would really appreciate it if you don't make us fight that thing ourselves…
sentence_0125.speaker: Old Policeman

sentence_0127.sentence: With that last thought, Sunny finally slipped into a deep slumber.
sentence_0127.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0129.sentence: And then, in the darkness, a faintly familiar voice rang:
sentence_0129.speaker: Narrator

sentence_0130.sentence: [Aspirant! Welcome to the Nightmare Spell. Prepare for your First Trial…]
sentence_0130.speaker: Narrator
